師.definition: teacher; master; expert; model; army division; (old) troops; to dispatch troops

師傅.definition: master; qualified worker; respectful form of address for older men; CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]

師兄.definition: senior male fellow student or apprentice; son (older than oneself) of one's teacher

師出有名.definition: lit. to have sufficient reason to send troops (idiom); to do something with good reason; to have just cause

師出無名.definition: lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom); to act without justification

師友.definition: friend from whom you can seek advice

師古.definition: following the ways of old; in imitation of ancient style

師大.definition: abbr. for 師範大學|师范大学[shi1 fan4 da4 xue2], normal university; teacher training college

師夷長技以制夷.pinyin: shi1 yi2 chang2 ji4 yi3 zhi4 yi2
師夷長技以制夷.definition: "learn from the foreigners in order to gain command of them", idea advocated by Wei Yuan 魏源[Wei4 Yuan2]

師妹.definition: junior female student or apprentice; daughter (younger than oneself) of one's teacher

師姐.definition: senior female fellow student or apprentice; daughter (older than oneself) of one's teacher

師娘.definition: term of respect for a teacher's wife; sorceress

師宗.definition: Shizong county in Qujing 曲靖[Qu3 jing4], Yunnan

師宗縣.definition: Shizong county in Qujing 曲靖[Qu3 jing4], Yunnan

師座.definition: (archaic form of address) his excellency the army commander

師弟.definition: young disciple (of the same master); younger or junior male schoolmate

師母.definition: term of respect for a teacher's wife

師父.definition: used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan); master; qualified worker

師父領進門，修行在個人.pinyin: shi1 fu5 ling3 jin4 men2 , xiu1 xing2 zai4 ge4 ren2
師父領進門，修行在個人.definition: the master leads you to the door, the rest is up to you; you can lead a horse to water but you can't make him drink

師範.definition: teacher-training; pedagogical; normal (school, e.g. Beijing Normal University)

師表.definition: paragon of virtue and learning; exemplary character
